narrative.narrative:
Your 2024 was the year you decided that Chumbawamba wasn't just a one-hit wonder from your childhood - no, you were going to prove to everyone (mostly yourself) that they were actually punk rock prophets. With 1,314 plays and over 73 hours spent in their discography, you got knocked down... and you got up again... 1,314 times, apparently. That's commitment to a bit, my friend.

But let's talk about your actual obsession: Shit Present's "What Still Gets Me" album. You didn't just listen to this album - you practically moved into it. Nine of your top ten most-played tracks came from this one record. You played "Voice in Your Head" 27 times, presumably because you needed someone's voice in your head that wasn't your own thoughts. The album racked up 307 plays, which means you listened to it roughly every 1.2 days. That's not a phase, that's a relationship.

Your taste is what happens when a punk show, a hip-hop cipher, and whatever Ween is doing collide in a beautiful disaster. Descendents, NOFX, and The Mr. T Experience kept your punk credentials intact, while Kendrick Lamar, Eminem, and 50 Cent's "Get Rich or Die Tryin'" (203 plays!) proved you contain multitudes. Speaking of which, you listened to 50 Cent's classic 203 times this year. Either you were very motivated to get rich, or you just really enjoyed the production value.

Your listening habits paint the picture of someone with a serious 9-to-5. You hit peak listening at 8 AM (probably commuting while contemplating existence), maintained strong numbers through the workday, and peaked again around 5-6 PM. Those 6 plays at 5 AM though? We're not going to ask if you were still up or already up, but either way, that's concerning.

July was your most unhinged month with 2,428 plays. That's 78 plays per day. Were you okay? Did something happen? Were you running from your feelings or toward enlightenment? The data suggests both, simultaneously.

And then there's "Redbone" by Childish Gambino. Fifty plays. Over 4.5 hours of that silky smooth paranoia. It was your late night anthem (26 plays after midnight), and on March 7th, you played it 26 times in a single day. That's once every 55 minutes if you were awake for 24 hours, or once every 37 minutes if you slept like a normal person. Stay woke, indeed.

You maintained a 45-day listening streak, proving that music isn't just a hobby - it's a lifestyle, a commitment, possibly a problem but definitely a passion. With 12,821 total tracks played across 326 artists, you consumed 670 hours of music this year. That's 27.9 full days of your life spent with headphones on, blocking out reality one Chumbawamba song at a time.

Here's to 2025: may your taste remain eclectic, your Shit Present obsession continue unabated, and may you finally answer the question of whether Chumbawamba has other good songs. (Spoiler: according to your 1,314 plays, the answer is yes.)

personality.type: The Anarcho-Punk Scholar with a Hip-Hop Minor
personality.tagline: Moshing at 9am, dissertating by noon, still playing 'Redbone' 50 times
personality.description: You're the rare breed who can spend 73+ hours with Chumbawamba in a single year while casually maintaining a Kendrick Lamar/Eminem appreciation society on the side. Your mornings are a punk rock alarm clock (peak listening at 8-9am, probably illegal), and you've somehow convinced yourself that listening to the entire Shit Present album on repeat is a personality trait. You collect bands like they're going out of style—326 unique artists suggests you're either incredibly cultured or have severe musical ADHD. The fact that 'Redbone' is your late-night anthem AND your most-repeated-in-one-day track (26 plays on March 7th—are you okay?) means you contain multitudes. You're equal parts DIY venue regular and chart-topper appreciator, proving that good taste knows no genre boundaries, only that Childish Gambino song at 3am.
personality.spirit_animal: A philosophy professor who moonlights in a hardcore band and secretly cries to Childish Gambino in their Prius

roasts: You listened to 'Redbone' 26 times in one day. That's not a vibe, that's a cry for help.
1,314 plays of Chumbawamba? You get knocked down, you get up again, and apparently you never learn to hit the skip button.
Your top 10 tracks are literally all Shit Present. At least the band name is self-aware about your music taste.
You spent 73 hours listening to a band called Chumbawamba in 2024. The 90s called, they want their one-hit-wonder obsession back.
8am is your peak listening hour with 1,832 plays. Nothing says 'good morning' like aggressively playing punk rock to avoid dealing with your feelings.

aura.vibe: Chaotic punk energy with surprising depth
aura.description: Your aura radiates raw DIY intensity with unexpected detours into introspection. Like a battle vest covered in patches that somehow also includes Childish Gambino pins, your musical soul thrives on contradiction. Chumbawamba's revolutionary spirit dominates your energy field—you're not here for mainstream acceptance, you're here for the mosh pit and the manifesto. The Descendents and NOFX fuel your fast-paced, caffeine-fueled mornings (that 8am peak is pure punk rock productivity), while late nights belong to 'Redbone' on repeat, proving you contain multitudes. You listened to an album literally called 'What Still Gets Me' over 300 times because authenticity matters more than variety. Your 40,000+ minutes of listening time suggest music isn't background noise—it's your lifestyle, your politics, your therapy. You're equal parts skate punk velocity and hip-hop flow, with a Ween-sized wildcard keeping everyone guessing. Your aura says: organized chaos, passionate convictions, and zero apologies for playing the same Shit Present track 27 times.

superlatives.award: Most Likely to Start a Punk Rock Revolution at 8 AM
superlatives.reason: Peak listening hour is 8 AM with 1,832 plays - nothing says 'good morning' like Chumbawamba and Descendents with your coffee

superlatives.award: The 'I Swear I'm Not Obsessed' Award
superlatives.reason: Played 'Redbone' by Childish Gambino 50 times, including 26 times after midnight AND 26 times in a single day - that's commitment to the vibe
Seamlessly vibed between anarcho-punk legends Chumbawamba (1,314 plays), Kendrick Lamar (591 plays), and Eminem (307 plays) - your musical taste is beautifully unhinged

superlatives.award: The 'What Still Gets Me' Gets Me Award
superlatives.reason: Listened to Shit Present's album 'What Still Gets Me' so much that 9 out of your top 10 tracks are from it - when you find your album, you REALLY find it

superlatives.award: Most Likely to Have a Work Playlist That Confuses HR
superlatives.reason: 8 AM to 5 PM accounts for over 7,000 plays of punk, hip-hop, and bands literally named 'Shit Present' - your coworkers are either inspired or concerned

hot_takes: You listened to Chumbawamba for 73 HOURS this year. That's not a music taste, that's a cry for help disguised as anarcho-punk commitment.
Playing 'Redbone' 26 times in one day isn't 'vibing after midnight'—it's a full-blown emotional crisis set to Childish Gambino.
You're out here pretending to be punk rock with Descendents and NOFX, but we all see that 50 Cent album sitting comfortably in your top 5. Pick a lane!
Spending 17 hours on an album literally called 'What Still Gets Me' by a band called Shit Present is the most on-the-nose mid-life crisis soundtrack possible.
Your music taste is 'I peaked in 1997 but also really respected Kendrick's beef with Drake'—which is actually kind of iconic.

suggestions: You spent 73+ hours with Chumbawamba this year—time to deep dive into their anarcho-punk roots with Crass, Conflict, and Propagandhi's politically charged catalog
Your Descendents obsession + 1,400 plays of pop-punk suggests you'd demolish Teenage Bottlerocket, Masked Intruder, and Dillinger Four's discographies in 2025
That 'Redbone' late-night anthem energy (26 plays after midnight!) deserves a whole vibe: try D'Angelo's 'Voodoo', Frank Ocean's 'Blonde', and SZA's 'SOS' for your 3am feelings
Shit Present clearly owns your soul with 493 plays—explore the UK DIY punk scene with Chubbed Up, Big Cheese, and ONSIND to keep that raw energy going
Your hip-hop hours (Kendrick + Eminem + 50 Cent) need some 2025 expansion: dive into JPEGMAFIA, Denzel Curry, and billy woods for that same lyrical intensity with fresh chaos
